definition: to drive away cares/to relieve boredom
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
to divert one's mind from boredom (idiom)

sentences.english: I spent my holidays travelling to some places near Zhuhai to relax myself.
sentences.chinese: 休了大假，去了珠海附近的地方，一個人散散心。

sentences.english: Let's invite her to the disco — she needs distraction.
sentences.chinese: 我們請她去迪斯科舞會吧，她需要散散心。

sentences.english: I need some distraction or a beautiful release.
sentences.chinese: 我需要散散心，或是一個美麗的解脫。

sentences.english: Let us go to the garden to make us feel better.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們到公園裏去散散心。

sentences.english: A holiday, the rainbow decided to take her out to play, also let oneself relax.
sentences.chinese: 朵放假了，彩虹決定帶她出去玩，也讓自己散散心。

sentences.english: Others make it their primary sport activity together with their families and friends to relieve boredom and stress.
sentences.chinese: 主營使其他人體育活動與家人及朋友散散心和壓力。

sentences.english: That day I prepared and Gardenia out relax and so hurried away.
sentences.chinese: 這天我和梔子準備出去散心，於是就匆匆的出去了。

sentences.english: OK, no problem, I would like to relax myself as well.
sentences.chinese: 好啊，沒問題，剛好我也想去散散心。

sentences.english: If I want to travel trip.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以我想散心旅行。

sentences.english: At the midnight, there were still some people hovering about the lake.
sentences.chinese: 直到深夜仍有一些人在湖邊踱步散心。

sentences.english: Hey, if you ever need to get away, come out to St. Louis.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想出去走走散散心，你可以來聖路易斯找我。

sentences.english: He wanted to go out and drive away his cares. Therefore he stopped his writing halfway.
sentences.chinese: 他想出去旅行散散心，於是中輟了寫作生活。

sentences.english: We can relax the pressure of travelling, or chatting with friends.
sentences.chinese: 放鬆壓力可以去旅遊散心，或者和朋友聊天。

sentences.english: Save the ink blue string, take her out Chiyin yue.
sentences.chinese: 救下了墨弦，藍嶽熾銀帶她出去散心。

sentences.english: He took me on his back to go out for relaxing in order to be pleased with me.
sentences.chinese: 爲了哄我開心，他揹着我到外面散心，給我講故事。

to go on a scenic tour
to go for an outing/to go on an excursion

to stroll

to wander aimlessly
to take a walk/to go for a walk
to go sightseeing/to spend one's leisure time wandering around
to roam around/to have a stroll
to take a walk/to window-shop/to stroll down the street
to go on a tour/to have an outing
to go with sb/to form companionships
to be away for the summer holidays/to spend a holiday at a summer resort/to prevent sunstroke
to stroll/to go for a walk
